thread.title: Anti-Trump protesters get a head start on blocking inauguration traffic, fail to halt DC just yet
thread.title_full: Anti-Trump protesters get a head start on blocking inauguration traffic, fail to halt DC just yet

author: Brett T.
title: Anti-Trump protesters get a head start on blocking inauguration traffic, fail to halt DC just yet
text:
— #NoFascistUSA (@RefuseFascism) January 15, 2017 
The group kicked things off Saturday — that’s #J14 in protest-speak — by gathering in the street, where it appears that police were on duty to direct traffic around what looked to be a relatively intimate gathering of anti-fascists. They’ve tweeted that they’ll be joined night after night until their numbers swell into the hundreds, thousands, and even millions. Anti-Trump protests already starting in D.C. "Reject fascism" crew is blocking off 14th. 
— Natalie Johnson (@nataliejohnsonn) January 14, 2017 Anti-Trump protest in the intersection of 14th and U. pic.twitter.com/4cl9fdCRbS 
— Kriston Capps (@kristoncapps) January 15, 2017 Someone tell these people they are just disrupting the traffic of people who 93% agree with them https://t.co/tnxfioLC3G 
— Ryan O. Ferguson (@ryanoferguson) January 15, 2017 
Attempting to disrupt the traffic, that is. If you will notice, police are facilitating the protest. Traffic is able to fast. Everyone here is fine, Ryan https://t.co/bw5D6x6g3G 
— Kriston Capps (@kristoncapps) January 15, 2017 
Everyone there is NOT fine. Even little children know President-elect Trump is mean and a racist. These kids hit the nail on the head. 
— #NoFascistUSA (@RefuseFascism) January 14, 2017 
That’s a cute kid in red coat; if we weren’t fascists ourselves, we’d find it a bit sad that he only really lit up with positive reinforcement when they managed to prod “He’s racist” out of him. @nataliejohnsonn Fascists pretending at resisting fascism. 
— David Stewart (@DavidInFlalala) January 15, 2017 @nataliejohnsonn 98% of d.c. went to hillary.
